H0.text: Solid to gas is the change that water will undergo after many hours in a freezer.

H1.text: Solid to liquid is the change the water will undergo after many hours when a student pours water into a cup and places the cup in a freezer.

H2.text: Liquid to solid is the change that water undergoes after many hours in a freezer when a student pours water into a cup and places the cup in the freezer.

H3.text: Liquid to gas is the state change the water will undergo after being placed in a freezer for many hours.

A4.text: At a pressure of one atmosphere (atm), ice melts or water freezes (solidifies) at 0 °C (32 °F)

A5.text: The addition or removal of heat can cause phase transitions: freezing (water to ice)
